intro: Helepta, commonly known as the common heather, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing shrub form and dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces white, pink, or purple blooms, depending on the species. Helepta thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to flourish in challenging environmental conditions.
